Read trackball data â€” read_trackball
text: Read trackball data variety setups configurations.

title: Read trackball data â€” read_trackball
code: read_trackball(   paths,   setup = c("of_free", "of_fixed", "fictrac"),   sampling_rate,   col_time = "time",   col_dx = "x",   col_dy = "y",   ball_calibration = NULL,   ball_diameter = NULL,   distance_scale = NULL,   distance_unit = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Read trackball data â€” read_trackball
text: paths Two file paths, one sensor (although one allowed fixed setup, of_fixed). setup type experimental setup used. Expects either of_free, of_fixed fictrac (soon). sampling_rate Sampling rate tells function long time integrate . sampling rate 60(Hz) mean windows 1/60 sec used integrate . col_time column contains information time. Can specified either column number (numeric) name column one (character). either datetime (POSIXt) seconds (numeric). col_dx Column name x-axis values col_dy Column name y-axis values ball_calibration running of_fixed experiment, may (necessary) provide calibration factor. factor number recorded 360 degree spin. can use calibrate_trackball function get number. Alternatively, provide ball_diameter distance_scale (e.g. mouse dpcm). ball_diameter running of_fixed experiment, ball diameter needed together either ball_calibration distance_scale. distance_scale using computer mice, might getting unit-less data . However, computer mice factor called "dots-per-cm", can use convert estimates centimeters. distance_unit unit used. distance_scale also used, unit scaled data. E.g. trackball data optical flow sensors, can use mouse dots-per-cm (dpcm) 394 setting distance_unit = "cm" distance_scale = 394. verbose FALSE (default), suppress warning messages.

title: Read trackball data â€” read_trackball
text: movement dataframe

what: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
text: Reads formats movement tracking data exported TRex (Walter & Couzin, 2021). TRex software tracking animal movement videos, exports coordinate data CSV format. function processes files standardized movement data format.

title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
text: path Character string specifying path TRex CSV file. file contain columns : time x y coordinates tracked points (e.g., x_head, y_head) x y coordinates centroid (x_number_wcentroid_cm, y_number_wcentroid_cm)

title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
text: data frame containing movement data following columns: time: Time values tracking individual: Factor (set NA, TRex tracks one individual) keypoint: Factor identifying tracked points (e.g., "head", "centroid") x: x-coordinates centimeters y: y-coordinates centimeters confidence: Numeric confidence values (set NA TRex provide )

title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
text: function performs several processing steps: Validates input file format (must CSV) Reads data using vroom efficient processing Cleans column names consistent format Restructures data wide long format Initializes metadata fields required movement data

title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
text: Walter, T., & Couzin, . D. (2021). TRex, fast multi-animal tracking system markerless identification, 2D estimation posture visual fields. eLife, 10, e64000.

title: Read TRex Movement Tracking Data â€” read_trex
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Read a TRex CSV file data <- read_trex("path/to/trex_export.csv") } # }

title: Validate file â€” validate_files
code: validate_files(   path,   expected_permission = "r",   expected_suffix = NULL,   expected_headers = NULL )

title: Validate file â€” validate_files
text: path Path(s) file. expected_permission Expected access permission(s) file. "r", file expected readable. "w", file expected writable. "rw", file expected readable writable. Default: "r". expected_suffix Expected suffix(es) file. NULL (default), check skipped. expected_headers Expected column name(s) present among header names. Default c("x", "y", "time").
